title: fat face. nice lowercase "s"
author: edfladung

comments.content:
Good match if you horizontally stretch Hawthorn and lower the apostrophe

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HawthornAsItstime_3668.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hawthorn-lt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hawthorn-lt/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/hawthorn-lt/")  
Don

Most probably ' [DeVinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/http:/typophile.com/node/99936)'. Also very close are [Romana](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/romana) and [Denver](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/denver).  
Some more digitizations and reinterpretations of De Vinne: [http://www.myfonts.com/search/de+vinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/de+vinne "http://www.myfonts.com/search/de+vinne"), [De Vinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102502/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/de-vinne) WTF

Every couple of months we do a DeVinne/Romana ID. In terms of making a digital match for this particular T shirt I think the Hawthorn variation is the closest match, if stretched as I suggested in my previous post. At least that's what I would use if I wanted to duplicate the T shirt lettering.  
Don
Maybe it wasn’t stretched before it was worn… ;-)

Now, now Riccardo -- that's prejudice against large people :)  
Skinnies shouldn't rule the world.  
Don
